Title: Second-Loss Tranche Spread Valuation
Notes: Pricing formula for second-loss tranche in CDO structure
column5: which provides protection against losses beyond the first-loss tranche attachment point. **Mathematical Foundation**: The second-loss tranche spread equals expected discounted losses divided by expected discounted annuity payments. This captures the incremental risk beyond the equity tranche. **Key Assumptions**: Sequential loss structure
column7: arbitrage-free valuation. **Practical Applications**: Mezzanine tranche pricing
column9: risk layering in structured finance. **Limitations**: Assumes tranche independence; correlation modeling critical. **Implementation**: Copula-based loss distribution modeling; Monte Carlo simulation. **Related Concepts**: Equity tranche (first-loss); senior tranche (higher attachment).

Title: Black-Cox First Passage Time Model
Notes: First passage time model for credit risk where default occurs when firm asset value hits a time-dependent barrier
column5: allowing for early default before maturity. **Mathematical Foundation**: Default time œÑ = inf{t: V_t ‚â§ K(t)} where V_t follows geometric Brownian motion
column6: K(t) is a time-dependent barrier. This extends Merton model by allowing default before debt maturity. **Key Assumptions**: Geometric Brownian motion for assets
column8: instantaneous default at barrier hit. **Practical Applications**: Corporate bond pricing
column11: risk management. **Limitations**: Assumes observable asset value; barrier monitoring assumptions. **Implementation**: PDE solution or Monte Carlo simulation; analytical solutions for special cases. **Related Concepts**: Merton structural model; reduced-form intensity models.
